main event: Four dull silver, circular objects were observed in the sky near Bangor, Maine on August 4, 1965.
interesting points: The objects were observed in a close diamond formation, initially moving from north to south, then three of the objects turned and moved east while one continued south.
The objects disappeared instantaneously after being observed for about 45 seconds.
The observers were initially looking at the lighting effects in the sky from a nearby state fairgrounds when they noticed the objects.

Two Air Force aircraft (a KC-135 and a B-52G) had just taken off from a nearby air force base using water injection, and the exhaust from those aircraft may have been a contributing factor to the sighting.
Local radar stations reported no contacts in the area at the time of the sighting.
result: Likely a reflection or lights from the nearby air force base and state fairgrounds, though the sighting remains officially unexplained.
